page.title: 13WILDLIFE
page.content: Wildlife on the Mendips is plentiful and varied due to the fairly sparse human population. Rare species of birds such as barn owls, sparrow hawks, kestrels, buzzards and the native woodpeckers for example, have a strong hold upon the Mendips. Many rare waders and other water fowl can be seen in great numbers at Chew Valley and Blagdon lakes. Animal wildlife is also abundant and varied on the Mendips. Rare creatures such as the badger and fallow deer can be seen if the naturalist is cautious. More common creatures such as rabbits, squirrels, stoats, weasels, hares, foxes and smaller mammals are abundant. Lepidopterists will find many fine specimens particularly on heathland and some traditional haymaking fields.
